title: goinstall does not properly fetch git release branch
body:
by **bill.burdick**: 
What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. goinstall -v -dashboard=false -u github.com/zot/bills-tools
goinstall outputs this for me:

github.com/zot/bills-tools
goinstall: /; /usr/bin/git clone http://github.com/zot/bills-tools.git
/mnt/aux/sandbox/go/src/pkg/github.com/zot/bills-tools
goinstall: /mnt/aux/sandbox/go/src/pkg/github.com/zot/bills-tools; /usr/bin/git pull
release
goinstall: === cd /mnt/aux/sandbox/go/src/pkg/github.com/zot/bills-tools; git pull
release
fatal: 'release' does not appear to be a git repository
fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly
--- exit status 1

Which operating system are you using? Linux

Which revision are you using?  c627e23260c7 release/release.2010-11-02

Please provide any additional information below.

Using git checkout origin/release instead of git pull release should work
this should also work after a fetch
git checkout will exit with 1 if there is no release branch
